title: 110_hr3866
content: The "Small Business Programs Act of 2007" includes the reauthorization of various small business programs such as BusinessLINC grants, Small Business Development Center Program, Women's Business Center Program, HUBZone, Office of Veterans Business Development, Advisory Committee on Veterans Business Affairs, and National Women's Business Council. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize program levels for fiscal year 2008, including $80,000,000 in technical assistance grants and $110,000,000 in direct loans. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize $29,300,000,000 in deferred participation loans and other financings for various programs, including general business loans, certified development company financings, specific loans, and loans under section 7(a). The Small Business Act authorizes $4,000,000,000 in guarantees of debentures for title III programs, $6,000,000,000 in guarantees for part B of title IV programs, and $7,000,000 for grants for the Service Corps of Retired. For fiscal year 2008, $20,000,000 is authorized for the PRIME program. In fiscal year 2009, $90,000,000 in technical assistance grants and $120,000,000 in direct loans are authorized for programs under this Act. Additionally, $29,800,000,000 is authorized for programs under this Act. The Administration is authorized to make $29,800,000,000 in deferred participation loans and other financings, including $20,000,000,000 in general business loans, $9,000,000,000 in certified development company financings, $750,000,000 in loans, and $50,000,000 in loans. Additionally, $29,800,000,000 is authorized for programs under this Act. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 authorizes the Administration to provide guarantees of debentures up to $4 billion. Additionally, the Administration can enter into guarantees of up to $6 billion for programs under part B of the Act, with a limit of 50% in bonds. Grants and cooperative agreements totaling $7 million are authorized for the Service Corps of Retired Executives program. In fiscal year 2009, additional appropriations are authorized for the Administration. In fiscal year 2009, $20,000,000 was appropriated to the Administration for the PRIME program. SEC. 3. BusinessLINC grants reauthorization increases funding to $7,000,000 for 2008 and 2009. SEC. 4. Small Business Development Center program funding set at $140,000,000 for 2008 and $145,000,000 for 2009. SEC. 5. Women's Business Center program reauthorization. SEC. 5. Women's Business Center program reauthorization increases funding to $17,000,000 for fiscal year 2008 and $17,500,000 for fiscal year 2009. Hubzone reauthorization follows. SEC. 6. HUBZONE REAUTHORIZATION increases funding to $20,000,000 for 2008 and 2009. SEC. 7. OFFICE OF VETERANS BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT REAUTHORIZATION sets funding at $3,000,000 for 2008 and $4,000,000 for 2009. SEC. 8. ADVISORY COMMITTEE ON VETERANS BUSINESS AFFAIRS EXTENSION. SEC. 8. Advisory Committee on Veterans Business Affairs Extension: Extends termination date to September 30, 2009. Conforming amendment for Small Business Act to October 1, 2009. SEC. 9. National Women's Business Council Reauthorization: Amends dates to 2008 and 2009. Passed the House of Representatives on November 6, 2007.
